conclusion: Consider the geometry of the semi-cylindrical body and the refractive index n.
The semi-cylindrical body has a radius R and a length L.
The refractive index n is the ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in a medium with the same refractive index.
For n = 2, the speed of light in a vacuum is c, and the speed of light in a medium with n = 2 is c * 2 = 2c.
The angle of incidence θ can be calculated using the formula θ = arcsin(c/2c) = arcsin(1/2) ≈ 30.53°.
The area A of a cylinder is given by A = πr^2.
The radius r of the semi-cylindrical body is R.
The length L of the semi-cylindrical body is L.
The angle of incidence θ is 30.53°.
Using the formula for the area of a cylinder, we have A = πR^2 * sin(30.53°).
Substituting the values, we get A = πR^2 * sin(30.53°) ≈ πR^2 * 0.5000 ≈ 0.5000πR^2.
The area S of the cylindrical surface is approximately 0.5000πR^2.
